gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Cursor
Class SelectionJPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Cursor.SelectionJPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class SelectionJPanel
extends ActiveJPanel

This class allows for the drawing of rubber band box/circle/point cursors. It is used by the SelectionOverlay to select regions of the underlying JPanel.

See Also:
Serialized Form

ELLIPSE

public static final java.lang.String ELLIPSE
"Ellipse" - This message String is used to select/deselect the circle cursor. The region this pertains to is the EllipseRegion. Ellipse is used because scaling does not always yield an exact circle.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

SelectionJPanel

public SelectionJPanel()
Constructor adds listeners to this SelectionJPanel. All boolean values are set to false. This JPanel is also contructed to receive keyboard events.

Method Detail

set_cursor

public void set_cursor(XOR_Cursor cursor,
                       java.awt.Point current)
Move the rubber band cursor to the specified pixel point. If the rubber band region was not previously started, this will specifiy the initial point for that region. If the rubber band region was previously started, this will specify a new location for the ending point of the region.

Parameters:
cursor - The type of cursor that was selected.
current - The point where the rubber band region should be drawn

set_cursor

public void set_cursor(XOR_Cursor3pt cursor,
                       java.awt.Point current)
Move the rubber band cursor to the specified pixel point. If the rubber band region was not previously started, this will specifiy the initial point for that region. If the rubber band region was previously started, this will specify a new location for the ending point of the region.

Parameters:
cursor - The type of 3 pt cursor that was selected.
current - The point where the rubber band region should be drawn

stop_cursor

public void stop_cursor(XOR_Cursor cursor,
                        java.awt.Point current)
Stop the rubber band cursor and set the current position to the specifed pixel coordinate point.

Parameters:
cursor - the type of cursor being used.
current - the point to record as the current point, in pixel coordinates

stop_cursor

public void stop_cursor(XOR_Cursor3pt cursor,
                        java.awt.Point current)
Stop the rubber band cursor and set the current position to the specifed pixel coordinate point.

Parameters:
cursor - the type of cursor being used.
current - the point to record as the current point, in pixel coordinates

getCursor

public XOR_Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String cursor)
Since there are 4 types of xor cursors, this method gives us which cursor was used.

Parameters:
cursor - - string label
Returns:
cursor - actual XOR_Cursor corresponding to the string label.

get3ptCursor

public XOR_Cursor3pt get3ptCursor(java.lang.String cursor)
Since there are other types of cursors, this method gives us the xor 3pt cursor that was used.

Parameters:
cursor - - string label
Returns:
cursor - actual XOR_Cursor corresponding to the string label.

getControls

public javax.swing.JButton[] getControls()
This method returns controls to be used as an alternative to key events when making selections. Also included is a "Clear All" button. If the disableCursor() method has been called, disabled buttons will be grayed-out.

Returns:
array of JButtons, each button corresponding to a region.

disableCursor

public void disableCursor(java.lang.String[] cursor)
This method allows users to disable cursors that were previously enabled.

Parameters:
cursor - A list of cursor names to be disabled. Cursor names are defined by the static strings provided by this class.

enableCursor

public void enableCursor(java.lang.String[] cursor)
This method allows users to enable cursors that were previously disabled.

Parameters:
cursor - A list of cursor names to be enabled. Cursor names are defined by the static strings provided by this class.

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled(java.lang.String cursor)
This method is used to check to see if cursors have been disabled.

Parameters:
cursor - The cursor name as defined by the static strings provided by this class.
Returns:
Value answers this questions: Is cursor enabled? true = yes.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
